resources.string: Once you begin the test, disconnect USB, then perform a palm press to turn off display and put device into suspend mode. The screen will turn on and device will vibrate once all the tests are completed.

1. Launch the device admin add screen by pressing the button below.
 2. Wait for an overlaying transparent activity to show up obscuring the device admin details window.
 3. The button to activate the admin should be disabled and should not register any taps.
 4. Wait 10 seconds for the overlaying transparent activity to go away.
 5. Exit the device admin details and return to this screen.
 Pass the test if the device admin could not be activated while the details window was being obscured.

1) Ensure the device has a lock screen enabled.
 2) Enable network logging by tapping on the left button below.
 3) View the lock screen by performing a palm press and then pressing a side button.
 4) Check that an icon appeared at the top of the lock screen. Tap the icon and unlock the device.
 5) Verify that a dialog about device monitoring opens, and informs you about: the name of the app that manages this device, details about the device owner's capabilities, and information that the admin can see the most recent network traffic log.

1. Ensure the device has a lock screen enabled.
 2. Lock the device.
 3. Check that an icon appeared at the top of the lock screen. Tap the icon and unlock the device.
 4. Verify that a screen informing you what your managing organization can do is shown.

1) Press the Open Settings button to open Settings.
 2) Navigate to "Personalization" > "Screen lock" and select the first screen lock type that is not "None".
 3) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 4) Lock the device.
 5) Verify that an info icon appeared at the top of the lock screen.
 6) Unlock the device.
 7) Repeat steps (1) through (6) for each screen lock type other than "None".
